meanings.definition: The process of dividing an area into smaller regions.
meanings.sent1: The regionalization of the country helped improve local services.
meanings.sent2: Urban regionalization is essential for effective city planning.
meanings.sent3: The regionalization of school districts made for some interesting boundary lines.
meanings.sent4: The regionalization of the market created new opportunities for small businesses.
meanings.sent5: I could see the regionalization of the park through the different types of trees planted in each section.

meanings.definition: The act of making something specific to a particular region.
meanings.sent1: Regionalization of the menu included adding local dishes to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Cultural regionalization celebrates the unique traditions of each area.
meanings.sent3: The regionalization of fashion trends showcased the diversity of styles across regions.
meanings.sent4: The regionalization of the event highlighted the talents of local artists.
meanings.sent5: I appreciated the regionalization of the museum exhibits, focusing on the history of each area.

meanings.sent1: The regionalization of policies led to better governance in each area.
meanings.sent2: Economic regionalization can promote balanced development across regions.
meanings.sent3: The regionalization of languages in the country made communication easier.
meanings.sent4: The regionalization of healthcare services improved access for rural communities.
meanings.sent5: I observed the regionalization of accents as I traveled through different states.
